channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: FDA approves updated Pfizer, Moderna Covid vaccines as virus surges; shots to be available within days
item.description: The Covid jabs target a strain called KP.2, a descendant of the highly contagious omicron subvariant JN.1 that began circulating widely in the U.S. this year.

item.title: Deutsche Bank shares rise 4% after settlement of bulk of claims in long-running Postbank suit
item.description: Deutsche Bank has reached a settlement with the bulk of claims in the Postbank suit, which have been hanging over the bank for years.

item.title: Mike Lynch, man once dubbed 'Britain's Bill Gates,' dies at age 59
item.description: Mike Lynch, who had just recently won a landmark U.S. fraud trial, was found dead in the wreckage of a yacht that sank off the coast of Sicily. He was 59.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: The search for a stock market alternative
item.description: Indian bonds attract foreign investors as Wall Street forecasts lackluster future growth in stock prices.

item.title: China's self-driving startup WeRide delays U.S. IPO as deadline looms
item.description: WeRide was expected to offer 6.5 million ADS (American depositary shares) in the range of $15.50 to $18.50.

item.title: Home sales rose in July for the first time in five months
item.description: At the end of the month there were 1.33 million homes on the market, an increase of 0.8% from June and 19.8% higher than July 2023.

item.title: British tech entrepreneur Mike Lynch and Morgan Stanley's Bloomer retrieved from yacht wreckage
item.description: Mike Lynch was one of 22 passengers aboard the Bayesian superyacht, which capsized while anchored off the coast of Sicily.

item.title: These are the 10 best 'workcation' cities in the world for hybrid workers
item.description: Budapest topped the list as the best destination for a 'workcation' in 2024, according to a study by the International Workplace Group.

item.title: 'The World' is a luxury ship that travels the world full time — here's how much an apartment on it costs
item.description: A resident explains the pros and cons of living on "The World" — a luxury ship with privately owned apartments.

item.title: Corporate loyalty does not pay off, HR expert says, as job hopping gains currency among young people
item.description: Just 23% of workers aged 42 and under expressed strong interest in staying with their companies long-term, according to a study by WorkProud.

item.title: Oil tanker abandoned, adrift and ablaze after Red Sea attack
item.description: Greece's Minister of Shipping and Insular Policy Christos Stylianides condemned the attack as a "flagrant violation of the rules of international law."

item.title: What a Harris election victory could mean for Europe and the trans-Atlantic relationship
item.description: Analysts at the Economist Intelligence Unit said they expect the substance of Harris' position on major international issues to be similar to that of Biden's.

item.title: India walks a diplomatic tightrope, making friends with Ukraine while ally Russia watches on
item.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Ukraine on Friday is likely to be closely watched by both New Delhi's ally Russia and by Western partners.

item.title: Bavarian Nordic shares pop over 13% on earnings beat, bumper mpox vaccine order
item.description: Shares of Danish biotech company Bavarian Nordic jumped Thursday after reporting first-half earnings and a bumper mpox vaccine order.

item.title: China's state media slams U.S. over Biden nuclear strategy report
item.description: The outspoken editor of the Global Times, a Beijing government mouthpiece, seized on a New York Times report to accuse Washington of hypocrisy.

item.title: Fed minutes point to ‘likely’ rate cut coming in September
item.description: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday released minutes from its July 30-31 policy meeting.

item.title: Treasury yields rise as traders await Powell remarks
item.description: The U.S. 10-year Treasury rose on Thursday as investors looked ahead to remarks from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell.

item.title: New York drug dealer whose prison sentence Trump commuted arrested on assault charges
item.description: Jonathan Braun, a convicted drug dealer and predatory lender was freed from a 10-year prison term when then-President Donald Trump granted him clemency in 2021.

item.title: U.S. job growth revised down by the most since 2009. Why this time is different
item.description: There's a lot of debate about how much signal to take from the 818,000 downward revisions to U.S. payrolls — the largest since 2009. Is it signaling recession?

item.title: China's 'growing authoritarianism' poses a global challenge, Taiwan's President Lai warns
item.description: Taiwan's President Lai Ching-te cautioned that China's "growing authoritarianism" does not stop with the island.

item.title: Asia markets mostly rise as investors assess business activity data from the region and Fed minutes
item.description: The BOK is expected to hold rates at 3.5%, but traders will watch the language used in its release to see if any easing of policy are on the cards.

item.title: 'Pick a number': Strategist says the U.S. dollar will drift much lower against the Japanese yen
item.description: The U.S. dollar is likely to continue to drift lower against the Japanese yen over the coming months, according to one market strategist.

item.title: China calls EU tariffs on EVs unfair, says it will take necessary measures to defend industry
item.description: Beijing said it continues to believe the EU's probe into China's subsidies for EVs are promoting unfair competition in the name of fair competition.

item.title: Five bodies recovered in wreckage of superyacht that sank off Sicily
item.description: The ship was violently rocked by a storm around 4 a.m. local time Monday while it was anchored near the Sicilian port of Porticello.

item.title: Paramount special committee extends Skydance 'go shop' period as it reviews Bronfman offer
item.description: Paramount agreed to merge with Skydance last month, but the company said it would have a 45-day "go shop" period to solicit other offers.

item.title: Microsoft will release controversial Windows Recall AI search feature to testers in October
item.description: It has been a bumpy rollout for a feature that was designed as an early example of an artificial intelligence model running locally on a Windows PC.

item.title: Ford delays new EV plant, cancels electric three-row SUV as it shifts strategy
item.description: Production at the new plant in Tennessee was initially expected to begin next year.

item.title: Former FTX exec Ryan Salame seeks to void guilty plea, says feds reneged on deal to end probe of his partner
item.description: Ryan Salame, a former top lieutenant of FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried, was sentenced to 90 months in prison.

item.title: Why a weakening U.S. dollar can help the consumer
item.description: A strong dollar may reflect economic strength, but it can have downsides for American consumers.

item.title: Microsoft revamps reporting structure to give better visibility into cloud consumption revenue
item.description: One analyst said Microsoft changes will provide better visibility into the software company's Azure cloud infrastructure business.
